intro: Cylindrolobus, commonly known as the slender-flowered orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are characterized by their slender, often erect stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale in color. They are native to various regions in Africa, particularly in arid and semi-arid environments. Cylindrolobus species are epiphytic or lithophytic, meaning they grow on other plants or rocks, and they rely on specific humidity and light conditions for growth. Their unique floral structure and ecological adaptations make them interesting subjects for botanical study.
